Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie. I’ve been okay. I reached out to a couple of old colleagues.
That’s fantastic! How did that go for you?
It was nerve-wracking, but I did it. One of them responded positively.
That’s wonderful news! How did you feel after sending those messages?
I felt relieved, like a weight was lifted off my shoulders.
That’s a great feeling! It sounds like taking that step was beneficial for you. What’s next in that regard?
I’m going to meet one of them for coffee next week.
That’s excellent! Meeting face-to-face can strengthen those connections. How do you feel about the upcoming meeting?
A bit anxious, but also excited. I hope it goes well.
It’s completely normal to feel anxious. What do you hope to discuss during your meeting?
I want to catch up and see if they know of any job openings.
That’s a good plan. It’s a great opportunity to network. Have you thought about how you want to approach that conversation?
I think I’ll keep it casual and just see where it goes.
That sounds like a healthy approach. Just being open and genuine can lead to meaningful discussions. Let’s talk about your family communication. Have you had a chance to draft that message?
I did! I wrote down my thoughts, but I haven’t sent it yet.
That’s a great first step! What’s holding you back from sending it?
I’m worried about their reaction, I guess.
It’s understandable to feel that way. Remember, you’re expressing your feelings, which is important. What would be the worst-case scenario in your mind?
They might not respond or might dismiss my feelings.
That’s a possibility, but it’s also possible they could surprise you. What if you focused on the potential for a positive response instead?
That could help. I want to be heard.
Exactly! You deserve to be heard. How about setting a goal to send that message by the end of the week?
I think I can do that.
Great! Let’s check in on your mood. Have you noticed any changes since last week?
I’ve felt a bit more hopeful since reconnecting with my colleagues.
That’s wonderful to hear! Building connections can often lift our spirits. Are there other activities or practices you’ve engaged in that have helped?
I’ve been biking a lot more. It’s nice to get outside.
That’s excellent! Nature can be so rejuvenating. Have you considered incorporating mindfulness or relaxation techniques into your routine?
I haven’t, but I’ve heard about it.
Mindfulness can be a powerful tool for managing stress and anxiety. Would you be open to trying a simple mindfulness exercise together now?
Sure, I’d like that.
Great! Let’s take a moment to focus on our breath. Inhale deeply through your nose… and exhale slowly through your mouth.
*breathes*
Let’s do that a few more times. As you breathe, allow yourself to let go of any tension.
This feels nice.
I’m glad to hear that. Mindfulness can be a great way to ground yourself. How do you feel after this exercise?
More relaxed, actually.
That’s wonderful! Incorporating short mindfulness practices into your day could help with your overall mood. As we wrap up today, what are your goals for our next session?
I want to send that message to my family and see how my meeting goes with my colleague.
Those are excellent goals! I’m looking forward to hearing about both. You’re making great strides, and I’m proud of you.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re welcome! Keep up the good work, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye, Ellie!
